column4: Hello, I am getting a pre-depend error, Dependency cycle error
I have one broken pacakge on my system, with a dependency cycle error
pastebin output of apt-get please
to paste.ubuntu.com ?
yes please
http://paste.ubuntu.com/129405/
sorry i forgot about you for a moment, let me look now
ok thanks,
ugh, according to your APT, you don't have... APT installed.
that doesn't sound especially good.
but then again, you *have* that stuff installed (including apt and libc6), or your system just wouldn't work and you couldn't use apt-get. so it's apt's database that's messed up. still, not good
do you have a /var/lib/dpkg/status-old file?
yeah, stuff probably got very corrupted then.
no, no need. just try using it as a backup. namely, do this:    sudo cp /var/lib/dpkg/status /var/lib/dpkg/status-backup  ;  sudo cp /var/lib/dpkg/status-old /var/lib/dpkg/status
then try again using apt-get
that's good, though i really recommend you run other stuff now to check that your system is mostly in a consistent state
output please
sudo apt-get clean, then try again (but i'm starting to think your filesystem might be very corrupt)
do you happen to have "smartmontools" already installed?
you can't install it if apt doesn't work ;)
the "database" (it's not really a database, just a text file, but) that contains the list of installed packages on the system
it got corrupted, so we restored it from a backup (which is done automatically)
let's see if apt finishes its job now, first
can you pastebin the output it gave so far, so i can start getting an idea?
